New Records: It was England’s first loss to Greece, which is ranked No. 48 in the world ranking, in 10 matches between the teams.
Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis scored the opener for Greece at Wembley Stadium in the 49th minute.
Jude Bellingham equalized for England in the 87th minute.
Vangelis Pavlidis scored Greece’s winner in the fourth minute of stoppage time.
Greece had three goals disallowed in the game.
There was a period of silence in tribute to George Baldock ahead of the game, with players wearing black armbands.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley fielded a team without a recognized striker in the absence of injured captain Harry Kane.
Cole Palmer started a competitive international for the first time for England and was deployed in central midfield.
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley ran into the first problems of his tenure as England’s interim coach after a bold team selection backfired in a 2-1 home loss to Greece.
Carsley felt emboldened enough to field a team without a recognized striker after leading England to back-to-back victories since becoming temporary coach.
Carsley insisted it was not an 'experiment' and emphasized the importance of being courageous and creative with their systems.
Vangelis Pavlidis paid tribute to George Baldock, describing him as a 'special guy'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece’s players celebrated one of their most famous wins by gathering together and holding up the No. 2 jersey of George Baldock, who was found dead in his Athens home on Wednesday at age 31.
